messages.title: Time for a change
messages.content: Do you feel let down by the three main parties? Are you fed up with politicians in general? Have you even given up voting altogether?

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The nation's railways to be taken back into public hands - renationalised.
A real crackdown on tax avoidance. Companies that trade in the UK should pay corporation tax here. More progressive income tax. The wealthy should be asked to shoulder more of the burden.
We want new houses to be built on brownfield sites to tackle the housing crisis.
One benefit for all to end sanctions, fraud, and expensive means testing.
A programme of public investment to get jobless people back to work.

mentions.candidate: Nick Crawley is the Green Party candidate for the Armley ward in the local council elections.

issues.socialWelfare: Universal Basic Income – one benefit for all to end sanctions, fraud, and expensive means testing.

housing.content: We want new houses to be built on brownfield sites to tackle the housing crisis.

leaflet.personalStatement: Nick joined the Green Party to fight against social injustice and growing inequality in the UK, where those who most need society's help are faced with benefit sanctions and the Bedroom Tax while others hide their money in offshore tax havens and tell us the country is broke.

images.caption: Nick Crawley is the Green Party candidate for the Armley ward in the local council elections on 7th May 2015.
